item.title: Install AIManager
item.description: Creating the AIManager Instance Now it’s time to create the AIManager instance Run the following command to create an instance of AIManager. cat << EOF | oc apply -f - apiVersion: orchestrator.aiops.ibm.com/v1alpha1 kind: Installation metadata: name: ibm-cp-watson-aiops namespace: cp4waiops spec: imagePullSecret: ibm-entitlement-key license: accept: true pakModules: - name: aiopsFoundation enabled: true - name: applicationManager enabled: true - name: aiManager enabled: true - name: connection enabled: false size: small storageClass: ibmc-file-gold-gid storageClassLargeBlock: ibmc-block-gold EOF This creates the Installation instance that the Operator will pick up and start the installation.

item.title: Check Installation
item.description: Check if the AIManager Installation is ready This takes up to 60 minutes This takes some time depending on what region of ROKS you have chosen. ‚ùó Wait for the installation to complete before continuing. The next step explains how to follow the installation progress. Check with the Command Line Run the following: while :; do clear; echo "Checking..."; echo "Exit with Ctrl-C"; echo "---------------"; echo "Not Ready: $(oc get po -n cp4waiops | grep -v Completed | grep -v Error |grep -v '0/' |wc -l| tr -d ' ')"; echo "Ready: $(oc get po -n cp4waiops | grep -v Completed | grep -v Error |grep '0/' |wc -l| tr -d ' ')"; echo "---------------"; oc get po -n cp4waiops | grep -v Completed | grep -v Error |grep '0/'; sleep 5; done This will list the Pods that are not Ready yet.
